snippet: Jason Itzler, who pleaded guilty to promoting prostitution three weeks ago, told a judge that he wanted a new lawyer after reading a profile of the one he had.
abstract: Jason Itzler, who pleaded guilty to promoting prostitution, is allowed to fire attorney Mark Jay Heller during sentencing and replace him with new lawyer; New York State Supreme Court Justice Thomas Farber grants Itzler just days to decide whether to withdraw his plea deal and go immediately to another trial, putting him at risk of a longer sentence.
lead_paragraph: Jason Itzler, who pleaded guilty to promoting prostitution three weeks ago, told a judge that he wanted a new lawyer after reading a profile of the one he had.

headline.seo: After Guilty Plea, Jason Itzler, Self-Described King of All Pimps, Fires Lawyer
headline.main: After Guilty Plea, Pimp Fires His Lawyer at Sentencing
headline.print_headline: After Guilty Plea, Pimp Fires Lawyer During Sentencing
